intro: Ranunculus aucklandicus, commonly known as the Auckland buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to New Zealand. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to eight petals, often surrounded by a ring of white or pale yellow sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
